question:
Match the content of List I with List II:

| List I | List II |
|---|---|
| 1. Polyembryony | p. Black pepper |
| 2. Perisperm | q. Banana |
| 3. False fruit | r. Lemon |
| 4. Parthenocarpy | s. Apple |
explanation: 1. Polyembryony is common in Citrus fruits like Lemon (r).
2. Perisperm (persistent nucellus) is found in Black pepper (p).
3. Apple is a False fruit (s) where the thalamus contributes to fruit formation.
4. Banana is a Parthenocarpic fruit (q) formed without fertilization.
